meanings.definition: Relating to or advocating liberation or freedom.
meanings.sent1: The liberatory movement fought for equal rights for all people.
meanings.sent2: The liberatory message of the speech inspired hope in the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The liberatory idea of wearing pajamas to work made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her liberatory spirit soared like a bird breaking free from its cage.
meanings.sent5: The liberatory concept of forgiveness can bring peace to the heart.

meanings.definition: Serving to liberate or set free.
meanings.sent1: The liberatory actions of the hero saved the town from disaster.
meanings.sent2: The liberatory effect of the medicine helped the patient recover quickly.
meanings.sent3: The liberatory decision to skip homework for a day felt like a rebellious act.
meanings.sent4: The liberatory power of music can uplift the soul in times of sadness.
meanings.sent5: The liberatory feeling of letting go of the past can be truly freeing.
